solution_04_inferential_statistics/03_hypothesis_tests_one_sample/01_hyptest_single_mean_v1

video

We need to calculate the \(p\)-value. \[\begin{aligned} p\text{-value} &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > \frac{\big|\bar{x}-\mu_0\big|}{\sigma_0/\sqrt{n}} \right) \\\\ &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > \frac{\big|35.65-33.9\big|}{7.8/\sqrt{58}} \right) \\\\ &= P\left(\big|Z\big| > 1.708667 \right) \\\\ &= 0.0875126 \end{aligned}\]

Of course you could have rounded the \(z\) score. Either of the following will also get credit.

\[p\text{-value} ~=~ \left(\big|Z\big| > 1.7 \right) ~=~ 0.0892\] \[p\text{-value} ~=~ \left(\big|Z\big| > 1.71 \right) ~=~ 0.0872\]


  1. 0.0875126
  2. FALSE / TRUE
